column5: is a small city in Odessa Oblast (province) of southwestern Ukraine
column6: in the historical region of Budjak. It is the administrative center of Bolhrad Raion (district). Population: 15

column1: Bolhrad was founded in 1821 by Bulgarian settlers in Bessarabia
column2: under the direction of General Ivan Inzov who is "revered" by Bolhrad residents as the "Founder of Our City." Bolhrad became part of Moldavia from 1856 to 1859
column6: before being incorporated into the USSR (in the territory of the Ukrainian SSR)

column1: The surrounding Bolhradsky district is predominantly populated by ethnic Bulgarians (a majority of 61%). Bolhrad itself is inhabited by a large number of Bessarabian Bulgarians and is considered by locals to be the unofficial capital of the Bessarabian historic district of Budjak.
The Georgi Sava Rakovski Bolhrad High School founded in 1858 is the oldest high school of the Bulgarian National Revival.
